For some reason, that attachment doesn't seem to be working, at least for m=
e. I will send it in a new post.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: A=
pril Abercrombie 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, May 27,=
 2009 4:43 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Electrical Question [1 Attachment]

=

  [Attachment(s) from April Abercrombie included below] 



  No this was =
a constant recording. This was caught in an empty room on my camcorder foot=
age, as well as on some other recording devices. 

  That coupled with the =
EMF spikes at the same time confirm that it was in the house, not in the ma=
chinery. If it is a static discharge, something is still causing it. But it=
 doesn't sound like a static discharge. I say tap, but it is more of a shar=
p pop.  I am attaching a clip of the sound if you want to hear it.

  This =
went on constantly throughout the entire time we were there, about 4 hours.=


    ----- Original Message ----- 
    From: Rj 
    To: EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps.com 
    Sent: Tuesday, May 26, 2009 5:30 PM
    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] =
Electrical Question


          It could: if you've ever noticed the tap so=
und when starting or stopping a recording session, assuming it is not being=
 caused by pushing a switch in the mic, the tap or pop you hear can be caus=
ed by the electronics as it begins to ceases recording.

          Also a s=
tatic charge can cause the pop.

          --- On Tue, 5/26/09, April Aberc=
rombie <april@...> wrote:


            From: Apri=
l Abercrombie <april@...>
            Subject: Re:=
 [EVP-ITC] Electrical Question
            To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
    =
        Date: Tuesday, May 26, 2009, 4:15 PM



            Thanks! Would t=
hat account for the tapping noise?

              ----- Original Message --=
--- 
              From: Rj 
              To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
  =
            Sent: Tuesday, May 26, 2009 4:07 PM
              Subject: Re: =
[EVP-ITC] Electrical Question


                    Yes.  Also faulty wirin=
g, which is even more dangerous.
                    Also with flakey trans=
formers or other power distribution in the area, or power lines.
          =
          Perhaps you can check with some neighbors, and see how their powe=
r is doing.


                    --- On Tue, 5/26/09, April Abercrombie <a=
pril@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


                      From: A=
pril Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
                   =
   Subject: [EVP-ITC] Electrical Question
                      To: "EVP-IT=
C Group" <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com>
                      Date: Tuesday, Ma=
y 26, 2009, 2:52 PM



                      Hi All,

                     =
 Is there someone here that can answer and electrical question for me?

   =
                   During the case that I recorded those possible EVP's-the=
re was a loud tapping noise that seemed to come from the 2nd bedroom. Upon =
checking my logs, every time one of  these clicks were heard, there would b=
e an EMF spike in the livingroom. The 2nd bedroom is upstairs, the livingro=
om downstairs. The home owners have also reported that they have a touch la=
mp that comes on all the time by itself and the lights in the Kitchen will =
dim occasionally.

                      Now these taps are not consistent =
in timing, loudness or rhythm. Could this be the work of faulty breakers?

=
                      Thanks!
                      April 


         




=
